com.tk.wightwhale.graphics

Class GraphicsController

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.tk.wightwhale.graphics.GraphicsController

  • public class GraphicsController
extends java.lang.Object
    Singleton class which encapsulates all the graphical display info and executes the update loop tasks

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static GraphicsController activeGraphicsController
      Active graphicsController singleton
      static LevelMap activeLevel
      Active level map
      static LevelController activeLevelController
      Active level controller
      boolean gameRunning
      Game running status - if false, step() does nothing

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      GraphicsController()
      Default constructor You MUST call "init" yourself if you use this
      GraphicsController(boolean importSettings)
      Constructs graphicsController and calls Init(importSettings)

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void close()
      Clears stored com.tk.wightwhale.graphics and removes activeController status if it has it
      void deregisterActive()
      De-registers the current GraphicsController in use as active.
      void exportAll()
      Exports all graphical items currently rendering to XML documents.
      LevelMap getLevelMap() 
      java.util.Map<java.lang.String,MovingObject> getMovingItems()
      Returns full Map of MovingObjects for current display area
      MovingObject getMovingItemsById(java.lang.String id)
      Returns a specific MovingObject by its ID value Note: this requires the entry tag and the id tag to match in the XMl for an imported level.
      PlayerControlledObject getPlayerControlledItemById(java.lang.String id)
      Returns a specific PlayerControlledObject by its ID value Note: this requires the entry tag and the id tag to match in the XMl for an imported level.

      Returns full Map of PlayerControlledObjects for current display area

      Gives the number of miliseconds between com.tk.wightwhale.graphics processing loops.

      int getWindowWidth()

      Initializes (or reinitializes) the GraphicsController to the starting GameSegment and Level
      void loadLevelImages()
      Loads all images for the current area to memory By default, this will let you specify the size for Static Items, but it will match moving + controlled items to the png size.

    • Constructor Detail

      • GraphicsController

        public GraphicsController()
        Default constructor You MUST call "init" yourself if you use this

      • GraphicsController

        public GraphicsController(boolean importSettings)
        Constructs graphicsController and calls Init(importSettings)
        Parameters:
        importSettings - boolean, true if you want to import from Files/GC_Settings.xml

    • Method Detail

      • init

        public void init(boolean importSettings)
        Initializes (or reinitializes) the GraphicsController to the starting GameSegment and Level
        Parameters:
        importSettings - boolean, true if you want to import from Files/GC_Settings.xml

      • loadLevelImages

        public void loadLevelImages()
        Loads all images for the current area to memory By default, this will let you specify the size for Static Items, but it will match moving + controlled items to the png size.

      • close

        public void close()
        Clears stored com.tk.wightwhale.graphics and removes activeController status if it has it

      • registerActive

        public void registerActive()
        Registers the current GraphicsController in use as active.

      • deregisterActive

        public void deregisterActive()
        De-registers the current GraphicsController in use as active.

      • registerStatic

        public boolean registerStatic(GameObject obj)
        Registers a GameObject for rendering
        Parameters:
        obj - the GameObject to display / use
        Returns:
        success value; log output shows errors.

      • registerMoving

        public boolean registerMoving(MovingObject mObj)
        Registers a moveable object for rendering
        Parameters:
        mObj - the MovingObject to display / use
        Returns:
        success value; log output shows errors

      • registerPlayerControlled

        public boolean registerPlayerControlled(PlayerControlledObject pcObj)
        Registers a player-controllable object for rendering
        Parameters:
        pcObj - the PlayerControlledObject to display / use
        Returns:
        success value; log output shows errors

      • getMovingItems

        public java.util.Map<java.lang.String,MovingObject> getMovingItems()
        Returns full Map of MovingObjects for current display area
        Returns:
        success value; log output shows errors

      • getMovingItemsById

        public MovingObject getMovingItemsById(java.lang.String id)
        Returns a specific MovingObject by its ID value Note: this requires the entry tag and the id tag to match in the XMl for an imported level.
        Parameters:
        id - String ID (unique among MovingObjects)
        Returns:
        success value; log output shows errors

      • getStaticItems

        public java.util.Map<java.lang.String,GameObject> getStaticItems()
        Returns full Map of GameObjects for current display area
        Returns:
        success value; log output shows errors

        public GameObject getStaticItemsById(java.lang.String id)
        Returns a specific GameObject by its ID value Note: this requires the entry tag and the id tag to match in the XMl for an imported level.
        Parameters:
        id - String ID (unique among GameObjects)
        Returns:
        success value; log output shows errors

        public java.util.Map<java.lang.String,PlayerControlledObject> getPlayerControlledItems()

      • getPlayerControlledItemById

        public PlayerControlledObject getPlayerControlledItemById(java.lang.String id)
        Returns a specific PlayerControlledObject by its ID value Note: this requires the entry tag and the id tag to match in the XMl for an imported level.
        Parameters:
        id - String ID (unique among PlayerControlledObjects)
        Returns:
        success value; log output shows errors

      • moveTo

        public GameSegment moveTo(int levelNum,
                          int mapAreaX,
                          int mapAreaY)
        Unloads current area and loads the specified level and gameSegment
        Parameters:
        levelNum - level number (in import/addition order)
        mapAreaX - First coordinate value for segment
        mapAreaY - Second coordinate value for segment
        Returns:
        GameSegment in use if successful, null if unsuccessful

      • step

        public void step()
        Moves all sprites 1 step forward

      • step

        public void step(double delta)
        Moves all sprites 1 step forward based on time in game loop Currently not functional
        Parameters:
        delta - time in miliseconds

      • exportAll

        public void exportAll()
        Exports all graphical items currently rendering to XML documents. In "Generated/..." directory.

      • getStepSize

        public int getStepSize()
        Gives the number of miliseconds between com.tk.wightwhale.graphics processing loops.
        Returns:
        1000 / fps = miliseconds wait time
